item.title: What You Need To Know About The Crisis In Zimbabwe
item.description: Zimbabweans who tuned into their state television channel in the early hours of Wednesday found that an army general, clad in military camouflage, had replaced their usual programming.
item.media:text: Zimbabweans who tuned into their state television channel in the early hours of Wednesday found that an army general, clad in military camouflage, had replaced their usual programming.

item.title: 5 dead in Northern California shooting spree
item.description: Five people are dead and two others were left wounded in a shooting spree that began at a home in Northern California on Tuesday and ended at an elementary school, officials there say.
item.media:text: Five people are dead and two others were left wounded in a shooting spree that began at a home in Northern California on Tuesday and ended at an elementary school, officials there say.

item.title: Sick death row inmate will be given special pillow to help him breathe during lethal injection
item.description: A sick death row inmate set to die by lethal injection this week will be given a special wedge-shaped pillow to help him breathe as he is executed.
item.media:text: A sick death row inmate set to die by lethal injection this week will be given a special wedge-shaped pillow to help him breathe as he is executed.

item.title: Olympic Weightlifter To Sell Gold Medal For Iran's Earthquake Victims
item.description: Olympic gold medalist Kianoush Rostami of Iran is auctioning off his prestigious medal to raise money for the victims of Sunday’s catastrophic earthquake on the Iran-Iraq border, which has left at least 530 people dead and thousands injured.
item.media:text: Olympic gold medalist Kianoush Rostami of Iran is auctioning off his prestigious medal to raise money for the victims of Sunday’s catastrophic earthquake on the Iran-Iraq border, which has left at least 530 people dead and thousands injured.

item.title: Sixth Roy Moore Accuser Comes Forward, Says He Groped Her In 1991
item.description: A sixth woman has accused Republican Senate candidate Roy Moore of sexual harassment, according to an account she gave to the Alabama news outlet AL.com.

item.title: Duterte warns military conflict with North Korea will ‘end humanity’
item.description: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte on Tuesday warned of the dire consequences that will result from a military conflict with North Korea.

item.title: Texas State University Halts Greek Life After Fraternity Pledge Dies
item.description: Texas State University in San Marcos has halted all fraternity and sorority activity after a 20-year-old fraternity pledge was pronounced dead after being found unresponsive at an off-campus apartment.
item.media:text: Texas State University in San Marcos has halted all fraternity and sorority activity after a 20-year-old fraternity pledge was pronounced dead after being found unresponsive at an off-campus apartment.

item.title: 14 More Lawsuits Filed In Aftermath Of Las Vegas Shooting
item.description: A Chicago law firm filed 14 civil complaints on Wednesday over the Oct. 1 shooting at a concert in Las Vegas that left 58 people dead and more than 500 others wounded.
item.media:text: A Chicago law firm filed 14 civil complaints on Wednesday over the Oct. 1 shooting at a concert in Las Vegas that left 58 people dead and more than 500 others wounded.

item.title: Israel PM offers quake aid to arch foe Iran
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has offered aid to victims of the deadly earthquake in Iran, insisting enmity between the two governments does not prevent humanitarian sympathy. The offer was made in a video conference with the Jewish Federations of North America. It comes as many of the tens of thousands left homeless by the quake have vented anger at the Islamic regime for what they say has been the slow response of the charitable foundations set up after the revolution of 1979.
item.media:text: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has offered aid to victims of the deadly earthquake in Iran, insisting enmity between the two governments does not prevent humanitarian sympathy. The offer was made in a video conference with the Jewish Federations of North America. It comes as many of the tens of thousands left homeless by the quake have vented anger at the Islamic regime for what they say has been the slow response of the charitable foundations set up after the revolution of 1979.

item.title: Father faints after learning that he and wife are having triplets
item.description: A father says he fainted when his wife surprised him with some special news: They’re going to have triplets. Robert Tolbert said that his wife, Nia, left him a gift bag and a handwritten note. Mr Tolbert figured, ‘Hey, it’s probably that FitBit I’ve been hinting at getting for a while now.” But he was dead wrong.
item.media:text: A father says he fainted when his wife surprised him with some special news: They’re going to have triplets. Robert Tolbert said that his wife, Nia, left him a gift bag and a handwritten note. Mr Tolbert figured, ‘Hey, it’s probably that FitBit I’ve been hinting at getting for a while now.” But he was dead wrong.

item.title: Australians celebrate same-sex marriage vote
item.description: Celebrations swept across Australia Wednesday as voters emphatically endorsed same-sex marriage after more than a decade of divisive debate.
item.media:text: Celebrations swept across Australia Wednesday as voters emphatically endorsed same-sex marriage after more than a decade of divisive debate.

item.title: Trump deletes tweet that appeared to reference wrong mass shooting
item.description: Hours after a shooting spree in Northern California left five people dead, President Trump tweeted his condolences — about the church shooting in Sutherland Springs, Texas, that occurred nine days earlier.

item.title: Watch Roy Moore's Lawyer Give A Train Wreck Interview On MSNBC
item.description: A lawyer for Alabama senate candidate Roy Moore responded to allegations of child sex abuse by invoking a reporter’s “diverse background” and suggesting one of the women accusing Moore was mentally ill.
item.media:text: A lawyer for Alabama senate candidate Roy Moore responded to allegations of child sex abuse by invoking a reporter’s “diverse background” and suggesting one of the women accusing Moore was mentally ill.

item.title: Prisoner kills inmate who beat infant daughter to death

item.title: The North Korean Soldier Who Defected Across DMZ Was Hit With 5 Bullets
item.description: North Korean media has not commented on the latest defection. The North Korean soldier who escaped into South Korea at the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) Monday is in critical condition at a South Korean hospital after suffering multiple gunshot wounds by his comrades. The unarmed man jumped from the car and made a mad dash to the border while North Korean guards let loose a hail of gunfire, The Associated Press introduced.
item.media:text: North Korean media has not commented on the latest defection. The North Korean soldier who escaped into South Korea at the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) Monday is in critical condition at a South Korean hospital after suffering multiple gunshot wounds by his comrades. The unarmed man jumped from the car and made a mad dash to the border while North Korean guards let loose a hail of gunfire, The Associated Press introduced.

item.title: Horrific highway pile-up kills 18 in China
item.description: A highway pile-up involving at least 30 cars killed 18 people in eastern China on Wednesday, local authorities said, leaving dramatic scenes of twisted and burnt-out wreckage and a towering column of black smoke. Grisly footage from the aftermath in the city of Fuyang in Anhui province showed sedans violently crushed to around half their original size under large cargo trucks and blood stains on vehicle doors as the sound of people crying could be heard. Police said another 21 people were injured including 11 severely in the latest horrific tragedy to strike China's accident-prone highways.
item.media:text: A highway pile-up involving at least 30 cars killed 18 people in eastern China on Wednesday, local authorities said, leaving dramatic scenes of twisted and burnt-out wreckage and a towering column of black smoke. Grisly footage from the aftermath in the city of Fuyang in Anhui province showed sedans violently crushed to around half their original size under large cargo trucks and blood stains on vehicle doors as the sound of people crying could be heard. Police said another 21 people were injured including 11 severely in the latest horrific tragedy to strike China's accident-prone highways.

item.title: GOP Senators Believe Roy Moore's Accusers But Not Donald Trump's

item.title: Mike Pence's NFL Stunt Cost Police Department $14,000
item.description: A planned political stunt by Vice President Mike Pence, in which he walked out of an NFL game in protest of players kneeling during the national anthem, cost the Indiana Metropolitan Police Department more than $14,000, new records show.

item.title: Airbus in $40bn deal to sell 430 A320s to US firm: source
item.description: Airbus is due to announce the sale of 430 of its medium-range A320 family of aircraft to US investment firm Indigo Partners in a deal worth more than $40 billion, a source said Wednesday. Airbus declined to comment. The order, believed to be the biggest ever for Airbus, will more than double the value of the airline's sales for the year.
item.media:text: Airbus is due to announce the sale of 430 of its medium-range A320 family of aircraft to US investment firm Indigo Partners in a deal worth more than $40 billion, a source said Wednesday. Airbus declined to comment. The order, believed to be the biggest ever for Airbus, will more than double the value of the airline's sales for the year.

item.description: Riyadh’s aim is to drag the United States back into the Middle East, tilting the balance back to Israel and Saudi Arabia. Many observers have connected the dots and concluded that Saudi Arabia’s crown prince is seeking to drag the United States into a war with Iran and Hezbollah.

item.title: Donald Trump repeats discredited stories about Barack Obama's Philippines trip
item.description: Donald Trump’s political career owes a great deal to conspiracy theories. The US president’s ascent into the world of politics was partially fuelled by pushing the totally erroneous theory Barack Obama was not a natural-born US citizen and it was therefore unconstitutional for him to be president. President Trump has repeatedly touted a lie about Obama being barred from even touching down in the Philipines in his Air Force One despite him never being faced with such problems.
item.media:text: Donald Trump’s political career owes a great deal to conspiracy theories. The US president’s ascent into the world of politics was partially fuelled by pushing the totally erroneous theory Barack Obama was not a natural-born US citizen and it was therefore unconstitutional for him to be president. President Trump has repeatedly touted a lie about Obama being barred from even touching down in the Philipines in his Air Force One despite him never being faced with such problems.

item.title: Zimbabwe's army seizes power, targets 'criminals' around Mugabe
item.description: By MacDonald Dzirutwe HARARE (Reuters) - Zimbabwe's military seized power early on Wednesday saying it was targeting "criminals" around President Robert Mugabe, the only ruler the country has known in its 37 years of independence. Soldiers seized the state broadcaster. The military said Mugabe and his family were safe.
item.media:text: By MacDonald Dzirutwe HARARE (Reuters) - Zimbabwe's military seized power early on Wednesday saying it was targeting "criminals" around President Robert Mugabe, the only ruler the country has known in its 37 years of independence. Soldiers seized the state broadcaster. The military said Mugabe and his family were safe.

item.title: How to Make Chicken Thighs with Harissa Vegetables
item.description: Sometimes, it’s best to add no liquid to the cooker. Here, we toss onion wedges, baby potatoes, and large carrot chunks with oil and harissa. We then arrange seared chicken thighs on top, and cook the mixture with no liquid added.
item.media:text: Sometimes, it’s best to add no liquid to the cooker. Here, we toss onion wedges, baby potatoes, and large carrot chunks with oil and harissa. We then arrange seared chicken thighs on top, and cook the mixture with no liquid added.

California Shooter Killed Wife The Night Before Attacking Elementary School
item.description: Kevin Janson Neal, who on Tuesday went on a killing spree that left four people dead and 10 injured in northern California, also shot and killed his wife the prior night, officials say.
item.media:text: Kevin Janson Neal, who on Tuesday went on a killing spree that left four people dead and 10 injured in northern California, also shot and killed his wife the prior night, officials say.

item.title: Jeff Sessions Says He Forgot Trump Adviser's Russia Comments In 'Chaos' Of Campaign
item.description: WASHINGTON ― Attorney General Jeff Sessions said Tuesday that he had “no recollection” of a former Trump campaign adviser’s comments on Russia during a March 2016 Trump campaign meeting on national security ― until, that is, it emerged that George Papadopoulos had pled guilty to lying to FBI agents working with the special counsel investigating Russian interference in the 2016 election.
item.media:text: WASHINGTON ― Attorney General Jeff Sessions said Tuesday that he had “no recollection” of a former Trump campaign adviser’s comments on Russia during a March 2016 Trump campaign meeting on national security ― until, that is, it emerged that George Papadopoulos had pled guilty to lying to FBI agents working with the special counsel investigating Russian interference in the 2016 election.

item.title: Could France's Leclerc Tank Destroy America's M1 or Russia's Best Armor in Battle?
item.description: Could Paris have the world's best tank? Could France's Leclerc Tank Destroy America's M1 or Russia's Best Armor in Battle? At 60 tons, the Leclerc is 10 tons lighter than most Western main battle tanks are. “So what do you think of France’s new super tank, the Leclerc?” a retired colonel in the French army’s logistical brigade jokingly asked me in 2002.
item.media:text: Could Paris have the world's best tank? Could France's Leclerc Tank Destroy America's M1 or Russia's Best Armor in Battle? At 60 tons, the Leclerc is 10 tons lighter than most Western main battle tanks are. “So what do you think of France’s new super tank, the Leclerc?” a retired colonel in the French army’s logistical brigade jokingly asked me in 2002.

item.title: Florida Police Believe A Serial Killer Has Struck Again
item.description: A suspected serial killer shot and killed a man as he crossed a street early Tuesday morning in Tampa, Florida, police say, the fourth such murder in little more than a month.
item.media:text: A suspected serial killer shot and killed a man as he crossed a street early Tuesday morning in Tampa, Florida, police say, the fourth such murder in little more than a month.

item.title: Donald Trump Jr private messages with WikiLeaks 'take the breath away', says former CIA director
item.description: The former director of the CIA has said Donald Trump Jr’s direct message exchanges with Wikileaks ahead of the 2016 US presidential election “take your breath away”. According to a report in The Atlantic, the WikiLeaks Twitter account sent a series of direct messages to Donald Trump Jr, the eldest son of President Donald Trump. The messages have since been sent to congressional investigators who are exploring potential links between the Trump campaign and the Russian government.
item.media:text: The former director of the CIA has said Donald Trump Jr’s direct message exchanges with Wikileaks ahead of the 2016 US presidential election “take your breath away”. According to a report in The Atlantic, the WikiLeaks Twitter account sent a series of direct messages to Donald Trump Jr, the eldest son of President Donald Trump. The messages have since been sent to congressional investigators who are exploring potential links between the Trump campaign and the Russian government.

item.title: Lebanese patriarch, in Saudi, says supports reasons Hariri quit
item.description: By Stephen Kalin RIYADH (Reuters) - Lebanon's Christian Maronite Patriarch, visiting Saudi Arabia in an historic visit to the ultra-conservative Muslim kingdom, expressed support on Tuesday for the reasons behind Lebanese Prime Minister Saad al-Hariri's resignation. Hariri, a Saudi ally, resigned abruptly on Nov. 4 in a move Lebanese political leaders ascribed to pressure from Riyadh. Hariri said his resignation had been prompted by an assassination plot and accused Iran and Hezbollah of sowing strife in the region.
item.media:text: By Stephen Kalin RIYADH (Reuters) - Lebanon's Christian Maronite Patriarch, visiting Saudi Arabia in an historic visit to the ultra-conservative Muslim kingdom, expressed support on Tuesday for the reasons behind Lebanese Prime Minister Saad al-Hariri's resignation. Hariri, a Saudi ally, resigned abruptly on Nov. 4 in a move Lebanese political leaders ascribed to pressure from Riyadh. Hariri said his resignation had been prompted by an assassination plot and accused Iran and Hezbollah of sowing strife in the region.

item.title: Zimbabwe: From VP sacking to Mugabe house arrest
item.description: Here is a timeline of the recent crisis in Zimbabwe, which has seen the military take control of the country with President Robert Mugabe saying he is under house arrest. November 6: Mugabe fires Vice President Emmerson Mnangagwa, a rival of Mugabe's wife Grace, 52, to succeed the veteran 93-year-old leader in power. November 8: Mnangagwa says he has fled the country -- to South Africa, according to members of his circle.
item.media:text: Here is a timeline of the recent crisis in Zimbabwe, which has seen the military take control of the country with President Robert Mugabe saying he is under house arrest. November 6: Mugabe fires Vice President Emmerson Mnangagwa, a rival of Mugabe's wife Grace, 52, to succeed the veteran 93-year-old leader in power. November 8: Mnangagwa says he has fled the country -- to South Africa, according to members of his circle.

item.title: An Inconvenient Sequel – the science, history, and politics of climate change | John Abraham
item.description: Former US vice president Al Gore delivers his speech during the closing ceremony of the Tokyo International Film Festival in Tokyo on November 3, 2017. Al Gore’s new movie ‘An Inconvenient Sequel’ is, in some ways, similar to his groundbreaking Inconvenient Truth project, but different in other ways. First, it gives some of the science of climate change.
item.media:text: Former US vice president Al Gore delivers his speech during the closing ceremony of the Tokyo International Film Festival in Tokyo on November 3, 2017. Al Gore’s new movie ‘An Inconvenient Sequel’ is, in some ways, similar to his groundbreaking Inconvenient Truth project, but different in other ways. First, it gives some of the science of climate change.

item.title: Gay senator Penny Wong cries tears of joy as Australia backs same-sex marriage
item.description: Australian senator Penny Wong’s tears of joy in front of TV cameras perfectly captured the country’s emotive response to the vote backing same-sex marriage. Wong, the country’s first openly gay female politician, was hugged by colleagues as the winning margin of 62 per cent to 38 per cent was declared. Penny Wong cries tears of joy after Australia's same-sex marriage result Credit: YouTube “To all Australians thank you for standing up for fairness and equality,” she later tweeted. “To my colleagues and all those who fought for this great outcome, thank you.” She later told reporters: “Thank you Australia. Thank you for standing up for the sort of Australia we believe in. An Australia that is decent, that is fair, is accepting and an Australia that turns its back on exclusion and division. “Now Australians have done their part, it is time for the parliament to do our part and together we will.” To all Australians thank you for standing up for fairness and equality. To my colleagues and all those who fought for this great outcome, thank you. pic.twitter.com/g8gaQJtzyC— Senator Penny Wong (@SenatorWong) November 15, 2017 She said that it is “time to change the marriage law”, adding: “It is time to remove discrimination, it is time for equality. “I hope that everyone in this parliament has heard the resounding voice of the Australian people today, a mandate for change, a mandate for fairness, a mandate for equality, because it is time. Members of the gay community and their supporters celebrate the result Credit: AP “To the LGBTI community across Australia, you didn’t want this process and it has been really hard for many of you. I hope from this you can take a message of solidarity, of support and of decency from your fellow Australians.” As the result of the postal vote is non-binding, a marriage equality bill is now set to be considered in parliament before Christmas. Man proposes moments after learning Australia votes yes to same-sex marriage on live TV

Thank you for standing up for the sort of Australia we believe in. Members of the gay community and their supporters celebrate the result Credit: AP “To the LGBTI community across Australia, you didn’t want this process and it has been really hard for many of you. I hope from this you can take a message of solidarity, of support and of decency from your fellow Australians.” As the result of the postal vote is non-binding, a marriage equality bill is now set to be considered in parliament before Christmas. Man proposes moments after learning Australia votes yes to same-sex marriage on live TV
